Wallabys: I was really hoping for something better than this.\u003cbr\u003eI ordered sliced brisket, smoked turkey, and tri-tip for my meats. Cheesecake Factory: What an enjoyable night we had. Wallabys: I have been to this location of Wallaby\u0026#39;s a couple of times. If you\u0026#39;re having cravings for BBQ and don\u0026#39;t have the time to cook your own, Wallaby\u0026#39;s will suffice. It won\u0026#39;t \u0026#34;hit the spot\u0026#34; or have you craving their particular version of barbecue, but it will do when you want those generic flavors.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eIn spite of the Aussie theme, Wallaby\u0026#39;s seems to go after eastern Texas barbecue, with sauces based on ketchup and brown sugar. Ultimately, though, the only thing they seem to really get \u0026#34;right\u0026#34; is the cinnamon honey butter. It\u0026#39;s whipped and light and oozing with flavor. When eating there, I prefer to fill up on that butter on their soft rolls.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe meats are highly disappointing. I don\u0026#39;t believe Wallaby\u0026#39;s smokes any of its meats. There was no semblance of a smoke ring on any meats, nor any wood flavor. The moistness of the brisket was the only thing going for it--it had no flavor of its own. The same goes for the drier pulled pork: it was bland, seemed to have been trimmed of all fat prior to roasting, and needed some serious seasoning and smoking. It\u0026#39;s usually my favorite meat but was the worst of the ones I\u0026#39;ve tried here. The barbecue chicken is only the top choice because the sauce it\u0026#39;s swimming in imparts flavor and moisture.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI haven\u0026#39;t tried the ribs, but if I come back they will be what I order.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eSides are bland and lacking in butter and seasoning. The salad is unimaginative. The potatoes are meh, and the cake is very dry. Like I said, the only thing you\u0026#39;ll love will likely be the butter. Ultimately, I can make better barbecue in my own kitchen sans smoking equipment, and you probably can, too. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe service at this location is quick and friendly, which helps \u0026#34;up\u0026#34; the rating in my opinion.
Chick fil A: Their chicken is REAL chicken (not that processed crap like other places. Their service is great! Cheesecake Factory: I still feel like tHey are a little over priced but then again... that cheesecake!! The raspberry and Oreo are Faves of ours!

Wallabys: I used to love Wallabys when they were in Lindon (maybe it was North Orem). I always ate a simple meal - pork sanger with potato salad. Yesterday I had some time to kill and noticed Wallabys was now on center street, pretty close to where I work, so I thought I would give it a shot.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI am guessing it is under new management or at least has a new chef - the experience was nothing like the Wallabys I used to beg coworkers to go to. The first signs that this wasn\u0026#39;t the same Wallabys came when I was ordering - I asked for potato salad - \u0026#34;we don\u0026#39;t have that.\u0026#34; It\u0026#39;s possible I was the only one who liked it, so I can\u0026#39;t fault them for that, but back in the day they had the best potato salad.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOh well, stuff changes - fine, I\u0026#39;ll get the fries that come with the sandwich. When my food finally came out (around 15 mins - seemed like a long time considering nobody else was in the restaurant yet they had a full kitchen) I was disappointed. The bread the sandwich was on wasn\u0026#39;t good at all, the meat itself was nothing like the tender, delicious pork they had before and the french fries were horrible. They tasted like the kind you freeze.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI contemplated giving them 2 stars instead of 1 just because they had diet mt. dew in the drink machine, but the food was bad enough that I won\u0026#39;t be going back even for the Mt. Dew. It\u0026#39;s sad to see a restaurant that used to be so good slide so far. In addition to the overall disappointing experience it was also expensive. Too bad...
Chick fil A: Bomb food, bomb service, I could legitimately put chick-fil-a sauce on all my food ever. It\u0026#39;s kind of become fun to see how many times they respond with, \u0026#34;my pleasure.\u0026#34; Like, they always remember. Well-trained, highly efficient restaurant and people.
Cheesecake Factory: Food is always great. Service is always a hit and miss. \u003cbr\u003eWe\u0026#39;ve had some great waiters and we\u0026#39;ve had a waitress who\u0026#39;s messed up our order and gave us attitude, for some reason.\u003cbr\u003eMeals are about $15-$20 on average. Their lower calorie menu is actually yummy, their pastas are delicious, and of course they have the greatest cheesecake (which are about $10 per slice.) \u003cbr\u003eAtmosphere complaints from my grandma: It\u0026#39;s very loud and it\u0026#39;s too dark (she can\u0026#39;t read the menu and she feels like she can\u0026#39;t see the person sitting across from her.)

Wallabys: Is \u0026#34;Australian BBQ\u0026#34; really a thing, as in its cuisine type? I can\u0026#39;t imagine, but I suppose it\u0026#39;s possible. Maybe one day I\u0026#39;ll recruit some actual Australians and rope them into coming here to find out how authentic it is...but most probably I won\u0026#39;t. I also really hesitate to call this BBQ, even if they claim it, since it really just isn\u0026#39;t quite that.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eAs you have no doubt guessed, this is a moderately Australian-themed restaurant that seems to be want to be a BBQ joint, with one sign proclaiming it to be the best in town (very original, no one ever does that). In this case, it most definitely is not and also reinforces the thought that if you have to be the one laying superlatives on your own head, they\u0026#39;re most probably not true. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eLots of different BBQ sauces here...the Tasmanian Devil one was acceptable, the rest much less so. The Honey-Habanero pork had plenty of the first, none detectable of the second and was very reminiscent of Lloyd\u0026#39;s. I asked for, but didn\u0026#39;t actually get a rib to try, so not sure how that was. I also was charged twice for a drink, but it\u0026#39;s not the end of the world, given how unlikely a return by me is. Staff was otherwise friendly.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI went with the surf and turf because I\u0026#39;m stupid and foods with cutesy names like \u0026#34;shrimp on the barbie\u0026#34; I\u0026#39;m evidently incapable of resisting. The steak was an absurd travesty, tough, chewy (held the BBQ sauce ok, though the bottles of that came out through the dumbest cap delivery system I\u0026#39;ve yet seen) and it\u0026#39;s hard to imagine anyone finding that good. \u0026#34;Fresh\u0026#34; veggies were steamed halfway to oblivion and chock full of onions (WTFF) and the actual shrimps were mostly ok, though flavor was a bit light. You inexplicably do not get served silverware, though and have to retrieve that yourself.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe best thing was the rice and beans side, which was basic black beans and white rice and that should probably tell you all you really need to know. They did also have Diet Mt. Dew on tap, good on them there. Inside is huge, lots of space for lots of people and despite this being a rarity, me coming during an actual peak lunchtime, it never got to above 40% capacity and I may be erring on the generous side here...it\u0026#39;s nice and new and shiny and mostly empty and after that experience, I know why. I don\u0026#39;t really care about all the silly pseudo-Aussie stuff, like crocodile heads on the shelves and so on, as long as the food delivers. Here it missed pretty considerably. When I shell out $18 for lunch and still leave kinda hungry, someone is doing something wrong. Won\u0026#39;t be me again...at least not here.
Chick fil A: If I could go back in time I would have my wedding dinner here. That\u0026#39;s how good this place is. I wish I could respond to bad ratings the same way Gordon Ramsey responds to people with peasant palates. Aka \u0026#34;get the f\u0026amp;\u20ac\u00a3 out of my kitchen\u0026#34;. Chic-fil-A is a sacred place and shouldn\u0026#39;t be desecrated by people who\u0026#39;s palate would rather eat at any fast food chain over Chic-fil-A. Cheesecake Factory: Came to this location for an early dinner with the family, and since I reserved a table online thru Yelp reservation, we walked in, and got seated within 10 minutes - while the rest of the walk ins had like 1.5 to 2 hours wait, at 4:45pm on a weeknight! \u00a0It\u0026#39;s crazy how PACKED this place is, on a weeknight, and on an early dinner time too. \u00a0We have had the privilege to sit in Alex\u0026#39;s section, and Alex was personable, friendly, and just really easy to chat with! \u00a0He happily fulfilled our wishes of never ending servings of the brown bread, with a plethora of butter plates each time! \u00a0Ordered the shrimp scampi plate, while hubby ordered his all time favorite, Chicken Louisiana pasta. \u00a0Kids ordered chicken tenders, fries, and mac n\u0026#39;cheese. \u00a0It was a fantastic dinner and ended it with our favorite Tuxedo cheesecake (you can NEVER go wrong with this choice). \u00a0I did order the strawberry shortcake but they changed how they serve the cake now. \u00a0It used to be one big piece and then a mound of vanilla ice cream, then fresh strawberries on top. \u00a0Now they have 4 small pieces of muffin cake, then ice cream on each one, then strawberries. \u00a0The cake tastes different now, more like a biscuit instead of a pound cake taste. \u00a0Too bad they changed it - the original one tasted way better!

Wallabys: Wallaby\u0026#39;s is SO GOOD. Highly recommend their pulled pork sandwich or their Aussie burger. Ingredients are high quality and fresh and the flavor is delicious!

Wallabys: I truly cannot believe that I was getting served instant potatoes. The stake was \u00a0warm but over cooked. The shrimp was cold! I loved the roll and the salad was fresh. I\u0026#39;m still in shock over the instant potatoes!

Cheesecake Factory: Disappointed. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eArrived about 5:30pm on a Sunday. Wallabys: Wallabys is an Australian themed BBQ restaurant\u003cbr\u003ein which you order at the counter. \u00a0They have\u003cbr\u003emany tables and booths if you wish to eat in.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eWhile we were studying the menu board on the wall\u003cbr\u003ethe cashier approached us and offered to explain\u003cbr\u003ethe menu and answer our questions since this was\u003cbr\u003eour first visit. \u00a0She made us feel very welcome\u003cbr\u003eand definitely made a good impression. \u00a0She was\u003cbr\u003enot wearing a name tag but the receipt said\u003cbr\u003eAlyssa.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThey had 9 or 10 varieties of meat.\u003cbr\u003ePrices for most dishes were in the $9 to $13 range,\u003cbr\u003eand included two sides.\u003cbr\u003eAfter you pay they bring your order to the table.\u003cbr\u003eBBQ sauces, condiments, and drinks are self-serve.\u003cbr\u003eI recommend the Pomegranate Limeade.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThe food is delicious, the staff is great,\u003cbr\u003eand the prices are reasonable.\u003cbr\u003eI highly recommend this restaurant.
Chick fil A: Fresh food, blazing fast service.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI\u0026#39;ve been there twice since they opened. Cheesecake Factory: I placed an order via Door Dash. \u00a0Food came hot and ready in a timely manner. \u00a0Part of my order was fried food stuffed with chicken and several of the pieces didn\u0026#39;t have any meat in them so it was just fried batter. \u00a0I love CF and have never had this problem, but when I saw this I definitely felt like I overpaid because I didn\u0026#39;t eat that food.

Wallabys: From Ca. And thank goodness for this place! We had dinner here for 12 people 2 nights in a row. Great staff, service and quality food for price especially.

Cheesecake Factory: Absolutely love this location. \u00a0The staff really cares. \u00a0We had a mix up with a yelp reservation and the opening manager called me personally to take care of us. \u00a0Our waiter is a ten year veteran of the brand and provides 5 diamond service. \u00a0Made for a very special brunch with loved ones. \u00a0Morning, noon or night still have to go with the Bang Bang chicken and shrimp. \u00a0 Hard to believe we have been able to enjoy Cheesecake Factory in Utah for a decade. \u00a0So grateful the staff and management team stay true to brand standards.

Wallabys: Thought it was very good. Nice environment too. Like the fact that you add the BBQ sauce of your choice to the meats. I enjoyed a combo of the Zesty sauce and Sweet and Spicy. The smashers were great... a fully loaded baked potato without the work. \u00a0My brisket was very tender and flavorful. My hubby\u0026#39;s pulled pork was delicious too! Don\u0026#39;t forget the wonderful rolls (Reminded me of Grandy\u0026#39;s ones in TX) and definitely request the cinnamon butter for them!!!
Chick fil A: Let me just start by saying I\u0026#39;m not a fan of fast food. I wish CFA didn\u0026#39;t qualify as fast food, but it does. And I love it.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis is Provo\u0026#39;s newest location, just opened earlier this month. Located on the corner of a very busy intersection where real life and BYU converge, don\u0026#39;t even attempt to come here around the weekday lunch hour. It\u0026#39;s mayhem at this point. I\u0026#39;ve kept my lunchtime visits to before 11:30am or after 1:30pm, and it\u0026#39;s been fine. Our last visit was a Friday evening around 7:30pm and the place was insane. They handled the inside crowd very well, and the line went fast considering the 30-some people in it at pretty much all times. Staffers were delivering food to the tables without the benefit of table tent numbers. Still not sure how they did that. But we were impressed.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis location has a play room for the kiddos, and boy did they ever take advantage of it when we were there. It\u0026#39;s nice to have a place to allow the littles to release their abounding energy, but I was wishing there was a one-way lock on the door to keep them in there. Don\u0026#39;t judge me - it\u0026#39;s just that kids have a tendency to race back and forth between the dining room and the play room...and when there\u0026#39;s a crowd, it\u0026#39;s just really irritating when parents pay no attention to what their kids are doing (ie. tripping people carrying food trays, screetching, running and landing on the tables of strangers, the list goes on...). But, this is the price you pay eating anywhere this close to BYU parent-student housing. Which is why we\u0026#39;ll rarely eat-in anymore.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOn to the food. I have always been impressed that CFA is very likely alone in the WYSIWYG category for fast food joints. The beautifully advertised sandwiches and salads actually look like they do when you get them, surprisingly. My recent favorite is the Chargrilled Chicken Sandwich, from its gorgeous fresh green leaf lettuce to the tomato that doesn\u0026#39;t look like its been on chemo. The chicken breast is flavorful and juicy. The sauces are delicious - particularly the new one: Honey Roasted BBQ - WHAT?!?! Yes. I\u0026#39;ve squeezed the life out of this packet to get that last pinhead-sized bit. If you don\u0026#39;t get at least one packet of this, ask for it. It\u0026#39;s not yet on the condiment bar.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eOther menu favorites for me are the their chicken nuggets. They\u0026#39;re just phenomenal, and made from actual chicken breast. Unlike other fast food chicken nuggets, you don\u0026#39;t bite into a CFA nugget only to see anything but lean chicken meat. It\u0026#39;s solid. And the dipping sauces are delicious; my favorite being the Polynesian (CFA\u0026#39;s version of sweet and sour). The others are really tasty, too.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eNow, here\u0026#39;s a new discovery for me at CFA - the Diet Lemonade. I\u0026#39;ve been a longtime fan of their regular lemonade. It\u0026#39;s as good as Hot Dog on a Stick\u0026#39;s famous lemonade. But I\u0026#39;ve not tried the Diet until recently, thinking it would suck. I was shocked to find out that it doesn\u0026#39;t! It\u0026#39;s just as delicious as the regular, and I can\u0026#39;t believe it took me this long to find that out. It\u0026#39;s what I\u0026#39;ll order from now on. \u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI love Chick-fil-A so much that I don\u0026#39;t even care that they\u0026#39;re not open on Sundays. I wish they were, and would normally deduct a star for it. But, I am willing to forgive because they have soothed my soul with their stellar service and deliciously and relatively healthy food.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003eI\u0026#39;m a big fan. BIG.
Cheesecake Factory: Service was amazing and the food was delicious. Reservation preferred because walk ins had to wait almost two hours
